title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 October 2015 - XWiki
content:
<Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
00:24 <abusenius> has quit  
00:25 <woshilapin> has quit  
01:12 <Trefex> has quit  
06:03 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:03 <Denis> has quit  
07:12 <Ramona> has joined #xwiki  
07:52 <Ramona> has quit  
08:05 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
08:27 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:29 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
08:35 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:43 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:04 <vmassol> good morning  
09:04 <vmassol> today is BFD I guess  
09:04 <vmassol> note that we're also 2 days away from 7.3M1 release date  
09:05 <vmassol> so we need to look at the CI to stabilize the build  
09:05 <vmassol> plenty of jobs failing ATM  
09:08 <woshilapin> has quit  
09:22 <Ramona1> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <tmortagne> vmassol: can I let you look at XWIKI-12667, you know this part better than I do: to summarize because of Zip explorer it's impossible to download a zip attachment located in a nested document  
09:57 <vmassol> ah yes indeed this is not supported  
09:57 <tmortagne> made the title more clear  
09:57 <tmortagne> you don't understand  
09:57 <vmassol> this is http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12448  
09:57 <tmortagne> you can't download any zip file  
09:57 <vmassol> so it's a dup of 12448?  
09:57 <tmortagne> I'm not talking about reading inside a zip file  
09:58 <tmortagne> the zip explorer breaks any zip attachment before you get a chance to download it  
09:58 <vmassol> only for Nested Spaces right?  
09:58 <tmortagne> seems so  
09:59 <vmassol> what does the zipexplorer have to do with download action?  
09:59 <vmassol> IMO it's the same issue  
09:59 <tmortagne> the zip explorer think you want to read in the file and is trying to find the attachment file name inside it  
09:59 <tmortagne> it should do nothing  
09:59 <vmassol> ok I see  
09:59 <vmassol> so yes it's the same issue definietly  
09:59 <tmortagne> no it's not the same  
09:59 <vmassol> it's just that I didn't think of this use case which makes the issue more important  
09:59 <tmortagne> yea a bit more important...  
10:00 <vmassol> ok starting meeting, I'll check later, adding to my stack  
10:00 <tmortagne> IMO it should stay as too different issues, it's ok that zip explorer does not support reading inside a zip file in nested document for now but it should not break everything  
10:01 <vmassol> anyway I'll check it later on

14:35 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <tmortagne> yea saw that but I'm trying to fix the URIBuilder classloader/dependency mess but I'm lost for now...  
14:36 <tmortagne> looks like some JAX-RS 1.0 URIBuilder is still in the classloader but I can't find it  
14:46 <OSIMasson> has quit  
14:58 <tmortagne> hmm now I understand but I don't understand how restlet was even able to build...  
15:05 <zzeroo> has quit  
15:18 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
15:19 <msmeria> has quit  
15:22 <tmortagne> seriously Restlet...  
15:22 <vmassol> :)  
15:24 <tmortagne> one more proof they don't care about JAX-RS: https://github.com/restlet/restlet-framework-java/issues/1158  
15:36 <tmortagne> tests involving REST should work better now, until we find another mistake like this  
15:36 <tmortagne> hope they will fix it quickly  
15:36 <vmassol> dreams are my reality....  
15:37 <vmassol> :)  
15:37 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
15:48 <mflorea> oldcore is failing for at least 1 day http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/lastBuild/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-oldcore/testReport/com.xpn.xwiki/XWikiTest/testGetPrefsClass/  
15:51 <tmortagne> looks like something that used to call exists() does not need to anymore (or it's a real bug)

17:15 <vmassol> ah that's what thomas fixed I think  
17:15 <vmassol> javax.ws.rs.core.UriBuilder.uri(Ljava/lang/String;)Ljavax/ws/rs/core/UriBuilder;
